answerText: Sinbad[10] Sinbad often encounters these gigantic snake-eating birds. He once is carried to one of their nests by strapping meat onto his back.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 6 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This man once travels to an island full of bird-people, whom he learns are all devils, and during his first adventure he saves the king's horse from drowning. For 10 points each: [10] Name this sailor whose seven voyages are recounted by Scheherazade as part of the 1001 Arabian Nights.
